event.doc_name: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

evidence.text: Plaintiff John M. Anderson is a 62 year old inmate at WCI. He was diagnosed with a severe eye medical condition since May 2023.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: John M. Anderson, a 62 year old inmate at WCI diagnosed with a severe eye medical condition since May 2023

evidence.text: Plaintiff Patrick Korkowski has been at WCI since June 27, 2023 with a preexisting dental issue. Plaintiff Korkowski was told at his previous facility of incarceration that he would have to seek continued dental care once he arrived at WCI. Upon his arrival at WCI in June 2023, Plaintiff Korkowski immediately notified correctional staff and medical staff that he had a serious, painful tooth problem.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Patrick Korkowski, inmate at WCI with severe dental issues requiring extraction after 4 months without treatment

evidence.text: Plaintiff Kenneth Dalberg is a 62 year old inmate who suffers from degenerative joint disease and has artificial implants in both shoulders, is diabetic and has continued heart disease.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Kenneth Dalberg, 62 year old inmate with degenerative joint disease, artificial shoulder implants, diabetes, and heart disease

evidence.text: Plaintiff Edgar Salinas-Leal has been diagnosed with kidney stones and complained to HSU at WCI for years without having received any treatment. His continued requests for pain management have been wholly ignored.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Edgar Salinas-Leal, inmate diagnosed with kidney stones and migraines with untreated pain management

evidence.text: Plaintiff Brad Schmitt suffered three (3) broken teeth in January 2023. He has suffered, and continues to suffer, pain from his dental issues. Plaintiff Schmitt has great difficulty eating and drinking.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Brad Schmitt, inmate with three broken teeth causing severe pain and dental treatment denied for 18-month waiting list

evidence.text: Plaintiff Jayvon Flemming has a heart condition and submitted HSU forms requesting to be seen on an emergency basis due to severe chest pains and difficulty breathing for which he was later evaluated after waiting five (5) days. Plaintiff Flemming also suffers from a broken tooth which penetrates his gum causing extreme pain for which he has been placed on the dental waiting list which may take as long as eighteen (18) months to be seen.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Jayvon Flemming, inmate with heart condition, broken tooth, and severe mental health issues listed as MH-2

evidence.text: Plaintiff Jason Natcone suffers from gastrointestinal issues. Particularly, Plaintiff Natcone had his colon removed via colonoscopy and wears a colostomy bag.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Jason Natcone, inmate with colon removed and colostomy bag requiring follow-up care denied during lockdown

evidence.text: Plaintiff Justin Welch has been diagnosed as having a fatty liver and borderline diabetic. Due to the lockdown, lack of exercise and poor diet, Plaintiff Welch was advised by a treating physician his condition is worsening and will continue to worsen until he is able to change his diet, get exercise and continued medical treatment.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Justin Welch, inmate with fatty liver and borderline diabetes worsened by lockdown diet

evidence.text: Plaintiff Ashton Dreiling is a prisoner in WCI. Mr. Dreiling has had his mental health negatively impacted by the prolonged lockdown. Mr. Dreiling, due to the inhumane conditions at WCI, has attempted suicide approximately four times due to a lack of sunlight, an inability to go outdoors, and other problems presented by the prolonged and unnecessary lockdown.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Ashton Dreiling, inmate with mental health deterioration leading to 4 suicide attempts due to lockdown conditions

evidence.text: Plaintiff Kevin Burkes is a prisoner in WCI. Mr. Burkes requested medical treatment, specifically optical assistance, during the lockdown. Mr. Burkes has an autoimmune disorder and lives with blurry vision and pain. Mr. Burkes was denied treatment via a note that said, “No optical during lockdown.”
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Kevin Burkes, inmate with autoimmune disorder and blurry vision denied optical services during lockdown

evidence.text: Defendant Wisconsin Department of Corrections (“WDOC”) is an entity run by the State of Wisconsin. The Department states it, “works to protect the public through the constructive management of those placed in its charge. We offer education, programming, and treatment to persons in our care that enables them to be successful upon returning to the community. Our mission is to achieve excellence in correctional practices while fostering safety for victims and communities.”
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Defendant: Wisconsin Department of Corrections, entity run by State of Wisconsin responsible for correctional management

evidence.text: Defendant Kevin Carr is the Secretary of the WDOC. Defendant Carr is responsible for the management of the WDOC.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Defendant: Kevin A. Carr, Secretary of Wisconsin Department of Corrections

evidence.text: Defendant Jared Hoy is the Deputy Secretary of the WWDOC and is second in charge of the Department.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Defendant: Jared Hoy, Deputy Secretary of Wisconsin Department of Corrections

evidence.text: Defendant Melissa Roberts is the Assistant Deputy Secretary of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections. Defendant Roberts is responsible for serving as the Secretary on corrections policy. Defendant Roberts is also responsible for implementing initiatives from the Governor’s Office.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Defendant: Melissa Roberts, Assistant Deputy Secretary of Wisconsin Department of Corrections

evidence.text: Defendant Randall Hepp is the Warden at WCI. As warden at WCI, Defendant Hepp is responsible for all staff and inmates at WCI.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Defendant: Randall Hepp, Warden of Waupun Correctional Institution

evidence.text: and YANA PUSHICH, SECURITY DIRECTION, WAUPUN CORRECTIONAL in their official capacities.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Defendant: Yana Pushich, Security Director of Waupun Correctional Institution

args.reason: All 16 distinct parties (10 plaintiffs, 6 defendants) extracted from the Class Action Complaint; no additional documents required to complete checklist item

All 16 distinct parties (10 plaintiffs, 6 defendants) fully extracted from Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief with supporting evidence. No additional documents required for this checklist item.
